thread.title: JetBlue Announces David Checketts to Leave Board of Directors

author: cnbc.com
title: JetBlue Announces David Checketts to Leave Board of Directors
text:
NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- JetBlue Airways (Nasdaq:JBLU) today announced that David Checketts, a member of JetBlue’s Board of Directors since 2002, will be leaving the board effective May 17, 2018.
"Being a member of the JetBlue Board of Directors since the very beginning has certainly been an incredible and fulfilling role," Checketts said. "We started the airline with a clear mission – to bring humanity back to air travel – and I’m proud of the incredible success JetBlue has become against all odds by bringing that mission to life. JetBlue has an amazing brand and a devoted following that is the envy of the industry and sets it up for future success in the travel space. As I move on to other opportunities, I look forward to following JetBlue’s continued success. I want to thank the current Board and the remarkable leadership team for what has been a remarkable journey.”
"From the very creation of JetBlue, Dave has provided his valuable insight and leadership which have resulted in the airline we are all so proud of today,” said Joel Peterson, chairman of JetBlue's Board of Directors. "Over the past 16 years, Dave has become very much part of our JetBlue family and I wish him every success in his future endeavors.”
“It has been my honor to have worked closely with Dave as JetBlue grew from a start-up airline into a powerful travel brand,” said James Hnat, JetBlue’s general counsel and secretary, “We are grateful for his leadership, stewardship and tireless advocacy for our values.”
"I would like to sincerely thank Dave for his contribution to the airline,” said Robin Hayes, JetBlue's president and chief executive officer. "Serving on the Board along with Dave has been a pleasure and a privilege and I have benefitted greatly from his business wisdom and counsel over the years.”
About JetBlue Airways
JetBlue is New York's Hometown Airline®, and a leading carrier in Boston, Fort Lauderdale - Hollywood, Los Angeles (Long Beach), Orlando, and San Juan. JetBlue carries more than 40 million customers a year to 101 cities in the U.S., Caribbean, and Latin America with an average of 1,000 daily flights. For more information please visit www.jetblue.com .
